title: Role of internal membranes in Chloroplasts

content.question: A mutation in the upland cotton plant causes the development of chloroplasts with a single outer membrane and no internal membranes. Which of the following would most likely be observed in chloroplasts of cotton plants with this mutation?

choices.label: They would be unable to remove waste products, because internal transport proteins would not be present.

They would be unable to generate the <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> needed to make sugars, because these processes occur on membranes within the chloroplast.

They would be unable to take up carbon dioxide, because <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is transported into the chloroplast in membrane-bound vesicles.
They would be unable to move within the cell, because only organelles with double membranes are mobile.

content.answer: They would be unable to generate the <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> needed to make sugars, because these processes occur on membranes within the chloroplast.
